intro: Cyrtandra insularis, commonly known as the island cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a waxy surface that helps retain moisture. Cyrtandra insularis is considered a rare and endemic species, facing threats from habitat loss and invasive species.
